The Crown Prince agreed to increase oil production to 13 million barrels a day, but said his country would be unable to increase output any further to meet increased demand for oil amid the global energy crisis. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But it came amidst protests from the opposition, which abstained and left the room.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The motion passed in the 126th chamber, with 68 votes in favor of the deal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The deal proposes that North Macedonia's constitution be amended to recognize a Bulgarian minority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Brussels welcomed the decision. President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, congratulated the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: bilateral meeting since 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Armenian diplomatic chief Ararat Mizroyan and his Azerbaijani counterpart Yehoun Baramov also met under a tense atmosphere, as fighting has occurred along the border of the two countries in recent months, including a shootout along the border on Friday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: After the meeting, Armenia's foreign ministry said the pair discussed a wide range of issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Mizroyan also called for the release of Armenian prisoners

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: held in Azerbaijan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In 2020, the two countries fought in a war over Nagorno-Karabakh, a territory between Armenia and Azerbaijan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: More than 6,500 people died over a period of six weeks of fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia brokered a ceasefire agreement between the countries, but Moscow has since stepped back from its role as primary mediator, and the EU has taken its place.

sentences.sentence: Inside Paris' Holocaust Museum, some little-known drawings are being showcased to the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The artwork by French comic strip artist Cabou recounts the fear and horror of the 1967 Veldahiv Roundup.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Parisian police officers arrested 13,000 Jews, including 4,000 children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We continue to have these books for the general public up until the 1980s, these school books that would tell you it was German soldiers that did this, Laurent Joly, a director of research, says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But these drawings by Cabot show only French policemen, because this is the historical truth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The legacy of the Nazi occupation and war crimes in France has been a complicated one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And it was not until 1995 that the government acknowledged the complicity of the French in Nazi atrocities, such as the deportation and wholesome murder of Jews in France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
